question_text: What distinguishes an internal cloud from an external cloud?
answer_options: An internal cloud uses metered pricing while external does not
An external cloud is always hosted on-site
An internal cloud is owned and operated by the customer organization
External clouds can only be accessed on a local network
correct_answer: An internal cloud is owned and operated by the customer organization
explanation: Internal clouds are maintained within an organization and give full control over infrastructure and policies.
